com.camerontec.util.collection.persisted.journaling

Class AsynchronousPersistentByteArrayStore

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.camerontec.util.collection.persisted.journaling.AsynchronousPersistentByteArrayStore
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IByteArrayStore, IVersionedSizedStore, IPersistentByteArrayStore, Closeable, AutoCloseable

    public class AsynchronousPersistentByteArrayStore
extends Object
implements IPersistentByteArrayStore
    The class provides a wrapper around the given IPersistentByteArrayStore to perform asynchronous writes.
    If the wrapped IPersistentByteArrayStore is an instance of JournalingPersistentStoreBase, every time a write is performed against the store, the given write request's offset gets updated.

    • Constructor Detail

      • AsynchronousPersistentByteArrayStore

        public AsynchronousPersistentByteArrayStore(String name,
                                            IPersistentByteArrayStore backingStore,
                                            int writeQueueSize,
                                            boolean blockingThread,
                                            NamedTaskExecutorService executor)
        Constructor.
        Parameters:
        name - the store's name, which is used for logging and JMX management purposes. Cannot be null.
        writeQueueSize - the size of the write queue
        blockingThread - controls the type of thread barrier used by the queue's consumer thread: if true, a blocking barrier is used, if false, a spinning barrier is used.
        executor - used to execute the queue's consumer thread. Cannot be null.
        backingStore - the wrapped persistent store

        public CircularBufferMXBean getCircularBuffer()
        Returns:
        the circular buffer used to write to the underlying store.

      • read

        public int read(IByteArrayStore.ReadRequest readRequest,
                BytesSegment segment)
        Description copied from interface: IByteArrayStore
        Submit a read request to the store.
        Specified by:
        read in interface IByteArrayStore
        Parameters:
        readRequest - The read request.
        segment - the bytes segment to read into, starting at offset 0 (which means that any pre-existing data in the segment is not preserved)
        Returns:
        The value length in bytes

      • read

        public int read(IByteArrayStore.ReadRequest readRequest,
                BytesSegment segment,
                boolean randomAccess)
        Description copied from interface: IByteArrayStore
        Submit a read request to the store. This is a lower-level variant of IByteArrayStore.read(ReadRequest, BytesSegment) allowing clients to specify whether this request is performed as a random-access operation or is part of a traversal of the collection, in which case the store implementation may be able to perform some optimizations (like caching I/O operations for example).
        Specified by:
        read in interface IByteArrayStore
        Parameters:
        readRequest - The read request.
        segment - the bytes segment to read into.
        randomAccess - true if this is a random-access read, false if this is a traversal read.
        Returns:
        The value length in bytes.

      • write

        public void write(IByteArrayStore.WriteRequest writeRequest)
        Submit a write request to the store. Request is processed asynchronously

        In this context a write request is any request which seeks to modify the contents of the store.

        Specified by:
        write in interface IByteArrayStore
        Parameters:
        writeRequest - The write request.

      • keys

        public void keys(IByteArrayStore.IKeyHandler handler)
        Description copied from interface: IByteArrayStore
        Iterates through the keys in the store.
        Specified by:
        keys in interface IByteArrayStore
        Parameters:
        handler - iteration handler. Method IByteArrayStore.IKeyHandler.key(BytesSegment) in this handler is called in turn for each key in the store. The iteration can be stopped at any time by having method IByteArrayStore.IKeyHandler.key(BytesSegment) return false.

      • flushToDisk

        public void flushToDisk()
        Description copied from interface: IPersistentByteArrayStore
        Flush the store to the underlying disk.

        On successful return the contents of the store are guaranteed to be synchronized with the underlying disk.

        Specified by:
